title:
Obstacle-Aware Length-Matching Routing for Any-Direction Traces in
  Printed Circuit Board
authors:
Weijie Fang, Longkun Guo, Jiawei Lin, Silu Xiong, Huan He, Jiacen Xu,
  and Jianli Chen
abstract:
Emerging applications in Printed Circuit Board (PCB) routing impose new
challenges on automatic length matching, including adaptability for
any-direction traces with their original routing preserved for interactiveness.
The challenges can be addressed through two orthogonal stages: assign
non-overlapping routing regions to each trace and meander the traces within
their regions to reach the target length. In this paper, mainly focusing on the
meandering stage, we propose an obstacle-aware detailed routing approach to
optimize the utilization of available space and achieve length matching while
maintaining the original routing of traces. Furthermore, our approach
incorporating the proposed Multi-Scale Dynamic Time Warping (MSDTW) method can
also handle differential pairs against common decoupled problems. Experimental
results demonstrate that our approach has effective length-matching routing
ability and compares favorably to previous approaches under more complicated
constraints.
